subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode Status
msgSnippet: ... It is an economical and structural position. ... And others? ... Not so. Structurally AGE and ICE are a mirrored pair, and QS EIGHT and QS I are a mirrored
messageBody:
On 16 Apr 2013, at 13:12, "Zyggy2" <jayson@...> wrote:

Thanks, I like some of your logic. In other areas, I do not agree with your method and it seems like the most extreme possible position to be taken.

It is an economical and structural position.

ICE and I, OUT and others

And others?

do not remotely match glyphs and you are matching phonemes. 

Not so. Structurally AGE and ICE are a mirrored pair, and QS EIGHT and QS I are a mirrored pair. In fact although the ductus for these has been changed, the skeleton underneath is the same. 


Similarly, structurally OUT and OIL are a mirrored pair, and QS OUT and QS OIL are a mirrored pair. In fact although the ductus for these has been changed, the skeleton underneath is the same. 


This sort of glyph change is found throughout the Brahmic family of scripts, for instance. 

LOCH, LLAN, EXCITE, EXAM weren't even in the original document and would only appeal to a marginal audience in the UK.

I don't see your point. These are extensions to the 

It seems to me that this may not be the right approach.

It's the one that's going to get results. Don't worry. You will be able to use the fonts you prefer, and you won't have to worry about how things are encoded. 

Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
